title: MySQLSUBSTRING_INDEX()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLSUBSTRING_INDEX()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return a substring of a string before a specified number of 
delimiter occurs:
SELECT SUBSTRING_INDEX("www..com", ".", 1);

Definition and Usage
The SUBSTRING_INDEX() function returns a substring of a string before a 
specified number of 
delimiter occurs.
Syntax
SUBSTRING_INDEX(
string
,
delimiter
,
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. The original string
delimiter
Required. The delimiter to search for
number
Required. The number of times to search for the
delimiter.
Can 
    be both a positive or negative number. If it is a positive number, this 
    function returns all to the left of the
delimiter
. If it is a 
    negative number, this function returns all to the right of the
delimiter
.
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return a substring of a string before a specified number of 
delimiter occurs:
SELECT SUBSTRING_INDEX("www..com", ".", 2);

❯
★
+1

quiz.question: What is If it?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of If it is 'a positive number'.

quiz.question: What is If it?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If it is 'a 
    negative number'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLSUBSTRING_INDEX()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLSUBSTRING_INDEX()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLSUBSTRING_INDEX()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
